intro: Albizia tulearensis, commonly known as the Madagascar albizia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, flat pods that contain seeds, typical of many leguminous species. Albizia tulearensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
